Notes: In Manda two protoforms (*yay-originally meaning 'my mother') merged phonetically.

Notes: Mandare-is an analogical back-formation fromre-t-; the Pengo oppositionar-/ra-t-is probably more archaic.

Meaning: to put on (coat, on another), fix (load on carrying-yoke)
Additional Forms: Also Pengoarpiyā-(<arpiya ā-) to put on, wear (coat)

Word: būra (pl. -ŋ) "small feathers, down, wool, pubic hair"

Notes: Initialn-in Manda is irregular and rather strange. The samen-is found in Dongriya Kuwi,  but still, the evidence is too few to reconstruct something other than an initial vowel.

Facultative vowel length in Pengo can probably point to a different reconstruction (especially since  inlaut*-n-goes back to a cluster because of the causative type of conjugation), but the variant with*e-should at  least be present in PPM as facultative.

Additional Forms: Also Pengoēt-(-t-) to make to dance, make (top) spin; Manda intens.ētka-
Also Pengogok-(-t-) to bend, twist;gomga- (road) to go crookedly (motion base only)

Notes: Different assimilations in both languages.

Notes: Loss of retroflex articulation in Manda is not quite clear; it either has something to do with the  auslaut position (although-ṇis not prohibited in the auslaut), or is due to development by analogy with the plural formkanke<*kaṇku.

Additional Forms: Also Pengokai ki-to wake (tr.); Manda (special base)kāt-(-t-) to watch for, wait for (me, etc.)

Meaning: to warm oneself (in the sun or by the fire)
Additional Forms: Also Mandakānd-(sun) to be hot; to warm oneself in the sun;kāpi ki-to heat, roast

Notes: Pengokitulis a complex form, whereki-is (at least etymologically) the root. Although-Vlis a Pengo suffix, nowhere else do we find the word for ear with a-t-, so we have to  suppose thatkitulis a compound form, with its second part unclear. In Manda the form is  simple; however, we have to explain the secondary voicening. Reconstruction of*kiyis,  therefore, impossible. If we suppose a development of PPM*-v> Manda-y(with no  counterexamples), the voicening should be due to PPM*kiv>*giv>*giy; however, it is more probable that-yis a suffix (like intrey'hair' <ter-y-), sogiy<*kiv-y. Pengokitulin this case goes back to*kiv-tul.

Meaning: father's younger brother's wife, mother's younger sister
Additional Forms: Also Pengokoglewoman (? originally 'girl');koy/i/(pl.koyik) (small) girl, daughter, sister
